intro: [WRONG START] Obernna behen subsp. commutata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed oberna, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and compound leaves with a distinctive, narrow leaflet arrangement. The flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. This species is often found in open, sandy habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
